byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE

abstract: Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani rejects compromise between Obama administration and Congress over impending nuclear deal, emphasizing that Iran is negotiating with consortium of several countries and not only with United States; Rouhani adds that Western sanctions must be lifted before Iran will sign any deal.
lead_paragraph: The president of Iran, reacting to the deal between the Obama administration and Congress, said his country was negotiating with six countries, not just the United States.

headline.main: Iran Assails U.S. Plan for a Vote in Congress
headline.print_headline: Iran Assails U.S. Plan for a Vote in Congress

snippet: The president of Iran, reacting to the deal between the Obama administration and Congress, said his country was negotiating with six countries, not just the United States.
